g-0: ^Please open the gate of the abandoned city, if you can.
g-1: ^Can you confirm that the threat is coming from south?

g-0: ^We're keeping a few cables, they might turn useful.
g-1: ^Call you later, the gallery is ending.

problem: ^Where have they gone?! We are going in circles.
^I feel like I've been here before.

c-0: ^Hundreds of drones on the ground, evenly spaced.
^Some lack propellers. Some others the engine.
c-1: ^ similar during our latest air reconnaissance mission…
g-0: ^/The city continues to function on its own.
^/This is where it amasses the drones for repair. It reuses their parts.
^/It operates drones at night or when illegal migrants are spotted.
^Strange: I haven't yet seen any flying yet…

c-3: ^This is Blue Team. We've got a situation here.
^An unmanned turret is keeping an eye on us.
^Equipped with a machine gun. Can it use it?

c-0: ^I am not used to getting nervous.

s: ^/Weird! I was sure it couldn't shoot anymore.

g-0: ^We'll have to go back and try south.

g-1: ^/Go south until the red steel tower.
^/From there you reconnect to the west.
^The road is blocked by heaps of stuff.

c-0: ^Had we kept those cables, we would.
^I am not used to getting nervous.
^/I'm sorry, but you can also climb bare-handed.
^Doesn't sound like a very bright idea.
c-2: ^Had we kept those cables, we could.
^We rule out the possibility to jump into the void like lemmings.
c-3: ^I can see where this is coming from, but no.
^No way, it would take too long.
^Our target is advancing too fast, slowing down is risky.

jump_with_rope: ^We've got those steel cables we found before.
climb_with_rope: ^We've got those steel cables we found before.
climb_without_rope: ^Hope everything goes well. Talk to you later.
^Nothing serious, but I'm afraid he broke a leg.
^We must leave him behind, can you send a rescue drone?

lemons: ^We are in front of a house that looks intact.

g-0: ^Turning nostalgic, now? We saw them sneak in there.
^/The villa only looks intact, but it's a hollow shell.

problem: ^Wall at… say 100 metres. With our lighting system you cannot be too precise.
^/I have not enough information to answer.
^/I see your position, but that area used to be densely developed.

g-0: ^I don't feel confident enough to approach.
^Yeah, but not the recharge station kind.
^/I'm afraid you have no choice but approaching.
^I prefer to monitor from here. One minute.
^Let's move to the right, we have to look for a way to circumvent it.

c-3: ^/I realised which wall it is, I think.

g-1: ^What have you people come up with?!
^/As I thought! It's the health check zone.
^They're like metallic parallelepipeda, definitely very tall metal boxes.
^/Diving space as needed, according to the different types of diseases.
^/Shifting and moving, they form quarantine rooms and alleys.
^/Every robot keeps the records for thousands of subjects.
^OK, but no one is infected now.
^/I cannot shut them down completely, from here.
^So what? We have to undergo the check and then they will let us pass, won't they?

c-5: ^, you would be placed in huge transparent crates and eliminated.

g-2: ^/From here, I can only freeze them in a position or let them move according to their algorithms.
^You only say that now?! Hurry up.

c-7: ^Even if you stop them, how do we cross the zone?
c-8: ^, how would you cross the zone?

g-3: ^I can see a sort of corridor in between the robots.

labyrinth_entrance: ^/I'll switch off the robots while you walk along the corridor.
^Thank you. But the corridor ends almost immediately.
^It's impressive, the robots' sides are extremely smooth.
^We are in a kind of narrow room now, and the only way out is the corridor we are coming from.
^/I'll try to switch them on again, to change their arrangement.
^/Don't freak out, but be careful not to get crushed.
labyrinth_progress: ^/In order to get out, you need to cross four different rooms.
^You tell us what to do. Did we see this one already?
labyrinth_door: ^ the door. It closes behind us.

c-0: ^, I can only try to modify the maze arrangement.

s4: ^a wall-mounted fixture for DNA testing and

s0: ^I feel like we've been here before.

b:
^Along the walls there are displays with diagrams and biometric scanners.

^Unsettling.

describe_cross: ^If you don't want to turn back, we can only take the

b: ^A robot placed itself up across, forming an arch.

^A robot raised over two others and left a low opening.

^It looks like an arch.

^The corridor is bending.

^Bending a lot in both directions.

^And these forks…

^Oops, no, they are dead ends.
^They come from regions with well-known intellectual flaws.
^ After all, you were bright enough to tell us not to take the cables.
^ You're also the same guy who let the unmanned turret shoot at us.
^We have reached a clearing with one way out.

labyrinth_restart: ^We're out, but we are again where we came in.
labyrinth_exit: ^But it's getting narrower and narrower: do you happen to know what it means?

c-1: ^, but only enough for one person to pass.

c-3: ^Hey! What the fuck is going on?
^We ran as fast as we could, we're out.
^But one of us was grinded in the maze!
^/My sympathy… I don't know what happened.
^I have to speak to the troop. They're upset.

tunnel: ^I'm not going to follow them through those pipes and I won't let my squad get trapped in there!
^ of us and I want us to reach the end of the mission as one.

s: ^/Send one soldier on a scouting mission

b:
^I don't trust you.

^The last time I did, an unmanned turret fired at us.

^/As you wish, in this case you need to follow the lane on the right.
^No clue what happened to her, but it looks dangerous to send another one to check.
^We are short of time. I leave a flare gun here, so that we can know if and when she's back.

bridge: ^I read a billboard: «Automated City News Bulletin: FM 109.0».

c-0: ^Something that may have used to be a bridge.
c-1: ^Rather, we have something here in front of us that may have used to be a bridge.
g-0: ^It leads to a massive, fortified building.
^Yes. Surrounded by a moat that gives the impression of being deep.
^There we go. The entrance gate is broken, but I eyed an opening.
^We are sneaking in. Over and out.

c-1: ^Too late. One was switched on and we analysed it.
g-0: ^Without them, the scum wouldn't get in.
^/Look for an access code, we might need it.
^/Excellent. Now walk across the castle and get out.

traffic_lights: ^Wait, wait… What were those thingies called?
^The gizmos with three lights giving traffic directions… come on!

g-0: ^/There are five at least. This is the only street having them.

problem: ^OK, I suppose that this street runs toward the factory.
^Let me note down that our lighting system needs improving…
^/Yes, you need to take that road, as far as I know.
^/Well, you are armed and marching through an abandoned automated city in order to accomplish a critical mission.
^/I assume that you can take the freedom of cutting a fence.
^At regular intervals on the fence there is a warning sign.
^/I doubt that channel is still active.
^We should climb over it, but it's very tall.

s: ^/Be careful that it is not electrified.

c-0: ^But I wouldn't want it to be electrified.
c-1: ^It's got cables powering it, but they look off now.
^Just to be sure, I'm cutting them. Wait.

s0: ^Wait, I'll try and contact the factory

b: ^OK, it's fine now. Cross your fingers.

trespass: ^I suppose that letting other people through is safe, isn't it?

b:
^Now the one soldier who's with me is passing through.

^Don't leave me alone…

g-1: ^Alright, we are on the other side.
^I'm calling you again when we reach the factory.

b: ^The only soldier I had with me… we lost her.
^I'm afraid there's nothing we can do for her: she's in ashes.
^We lost two, and I'm alone now.
^One is just wounded, but the other…
^I'll complete the mission and be back.
^Don't fret. A rescue drone is coming.
^We lost two. One is just wounded, but the other…
^Let's attempt to save her at least.
^Don't fret. A rescue drone is coming.
^We'll complete the mission and be back.

burn: ^I don't usually get emotional. Let's proceed.

factory_east: ^/Indeed, but the automated city didn't realise it.

b: ^I'm letting the others in from here. I try to catch them from the other door.

^Wait.

^I'm letting the other soldier in from here. I try to catch them from the other door.
^I'm the only one left, but that should be enough.

g-1: ^I don't want them to escape from the other entrances.

infiltrate: ^/You're alone, we need to be clever.
^Ho capito dove si trovano: nel magazzino.

c-1: ^C'è una porta, il cartello dice che è il locale frigorifero.

c-0: ^ da cui puoi prenderli di sorpresa.

get_them: ^Si stanno nutrendo di conserve di frutta.

b: ^Ah! Mi sono riunita con la Squadra Rossa!

g-1: ^Meno uno. Ho liquidato uno degli obiettivi.

b: ^La porta del locale frigorifero è bloccata.

b: ^a porta del locale frigorifero è bloccata.

s0: ^C'è un'altra porta per uscire dal lato opposto, ma non credo mi serva

c-1: ^Non dovremmo perdere tempo in questo modo.

freeze_one: ^/Direi che la Squadra Blu ha finito di perseguitare migranti.
freeze_both: ^/Direi che la vostra missione sia fallita.
